meanings.definition: A response to a stimulus that is not dependent on the direction of the stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The nastic of the plant to light caused it to open its petals.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nastic of the flower to understand its behavior.
meanings.sent3: The nastic of the cactus to water made it dance in the desert.
meanings.sent4: Her quick nastic to danger saved her from the approaching threat.
meanings.sent5: The nastic of the sunflower tracking the sun was a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: A type of movement in plants that is not dependent on the direction of the stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The nastic of the leaves allowed the plant to adapt to changes in light.
meanings.sent2: Gardening enthusiasts appreciate the nastic of flowers in response to touch.
meanings.sent3: The nastic of the vine seemed like a graceful dance in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The nastic of the tree branches reaching for sunlight was a natural wonder.
meanings.sent5: The nastic of the ivy climbing the wall was a testament to its resilience.
